channel.title: What is the difference?
channel.description: what is the diffrence between C++ and C# and java?

item.description:
@n33bz0rpl0x wrote:

[quote=“spy man47, post:4, topic:350367”]I think C++ Means a java pro

C# is a java coder

java is Java…[/quote]

I wouldn’t even post if you don’t know the meaning.

Read full topic

@krackkid wrote:

Read full topic

item.title: What is the difference?
item.dc:creator: @k_a_h_leader Aeolian
item.description:
@k_a_h_leader wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:9, topic:350367”]C++ (C with classes) is a high level language with elements of a low level language (direct memory management etc). The other two are just high level language. All three languages have some basics in common (object orientated) however java and C# share a larger similarity.

C++ and C# are both copmiled into machine code executables while java is compiled into bytecode which can be ran on a multitude of systems using the java virtual machine.

In short, java and c# are easier than c++. C++ is used for proper games, applications, java is used for web applets/games and some less intensive programs and finally c# is useless (sorry for my biasedness)[/quote]

C# is used for a lot of console games, so I wouldn’t call it useless.

Read full topic

c++ or C#

item.title: What is the difference?
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

C++ (C with classes) is a high level language with elements of a low level language (direct memory management etc). The other two are just high level language. All three languages have some basics in common (object orientated) however java and C# share a larger similarity.

C++ and C# are both copmiled into machine code executables while java is compiled into bytecode which can be ran on a multitude of systems using the java virtual machine.

In short, java and c# are easier than c++. C++ is used for proper games, applications, java is used for web applets/games and some less intensive programs and finally c# is useless (sorry for my biasedness)

Read full topic

item.title: What is the difference?
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

C++ vs. C#

Thinking Parallel – 6 Mar 07

C++ vs. C# - a Checklist from a C++ Programmers Point of View - Thinking...

I realize for most of you this is probably old news. I have been taking a first look at C# a little while ago, because I wanted to know if it is worth looking into, and because I am thinking about polishing up my class on Parallel Programming here at...

C# vs. Java
http://www.25hoursaday.com/CsharpVsJava.html

C++ vs. Java
http://www.computing.dcu.ie/~renaat/projects/cvjava.html
